beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Le Grand du Nord. Grand Marais, Minnesota. 110 mi. Rolling terrain through Minnesota Northwoods. 5 thousand ft over 110 miles = constant ups and downs, no sustained climbs. Mix of smooth gravel forest roads, paved sections, and technical doubletrack. Smoother than mountain gravel but never flat.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Prestige. 5 out of 5. The one people ask about first. UCI Gravel World Series status draws international competition to the North Shore. Experience. 5 out of 5. Once-in-a-lifetime course experience. Grand Marais delivers destination racing with Lake Superior as backdrop. Field Depth. 5 out of 5. World-class athletes. And they race hard. UCI Gravel World Series status brings international talent to Minnesota. Length. 4 out of 5. Double-digit hours are on the table. 110 miles tests endurance and race management across Minnesota Northwoods terrain. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Remote terrain. Self-sufficiency required. The route travels through remote Boundary Waters country and along Devil's Track Lake. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. High-quality event. Attention to detail shows. Well-organized aid stations at key locations like Eagle Mountain trailhead provide quality support. Community. 4 out of 5. The post-race scene is half the event. Minnesota cycling culture creates supportive atmosphere despite the large field. Value. 4 out of 5. One of the better deals in gravel. Registration runs $90-$140 for UCI-level organization and access to premier North Shore terrain.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Expenses. 4 out of 5. Expensive. Travel and lodging add up fast. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Requires line choice. Rewards the attentive rider. Elevation. 3 out of 5. The hills sort the trained from the untrained. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: The North Shore UCI Showcase. You need the fitness for 110 miles and 5 thousand feet. that's six hours minimum of rolling punishment through forest roads. The course isn't technically brutal, but it's relentlessly rolling, and those doubletrack sections at mile 80 will test your focus when you're cooked. If you can't handle pack racing with 2,000 riders or the possibility of 45-degree rain, stay home.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Le Grand du Nord isn't quite right for you. Heck of the North offers more technical challenge in the same region if you want sharper teeth. For similar distance and beauty with fewer people, try Gravel Worlds in Nebraska or SBT GRVL in Colorado. both deliver the suffering without the Minnesota crowd.
